Provided by
Programme Type
Master of Science in Marketing Science
The MSc Marketing Science is designed to develop comprehensive marketing expertise with the latest thinking, techniques and tools.
The curriculum delivers the fundamental knowledge of marketing and consumer insights together with the latest knowledge on marketing technology such as AR/VR and AI in marketing, to empower participants to lead marketing campaigns in this digital
era.
For full programme details, please refer to MSc Marketing Science.
Companies are increasingly aware of the value of technologies such as data analytics and artificial intelligence in developing more effective and intelligent marketing. As such, this intensive and academically challenging programme focuses on developing a holistic understanding in the field of marketing through comprehensive and up-to-date knowledge of consumer insight and technology.
Upon completion, our participants will:
Develop 360-degree competency by developing keen consumer insights through a thorough understanding of marketing frameworks, consumer psychology and new technology.
Be equipped with advanced marketing skill sets to navigate the fast-changing marketing landscape with our cutting-edge modules in AR/VR, AI and Robotics, Consumer Neuroscience & Neuromarketing, and Ethnography.
Apply classroom learnings to real-world challenges with ease through our practice-oriented teaching approach and interactive classes which foster discussions and debates.
Applicants who wish to apply to the MSc Marketing Science are required to meet the admission requirements below:
The institutional code for the following tests are:
Application Deadlines:
Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and early submission is encouraged.
Programme Fee (Academic Year 2024):
S$63,220.00 (inclusive of 9% GST and enrolment fee)
Application Fee:
MSc Marketing Science is a one-year full-time programme and our modules are built on three areas of focus – Marketing, Consumer Insights and Technology.
An optional internship module is available to participants who wish to gain real-world work experience.  The internship will take place from July to December after the completion of all the modules in Trimester 3.
MMS participants will complete 12 modules over three trimesters in a year.
Core Modules:
Consumer Insight Modules:
Technology Modules:
Our MSc Marketing Science graduates are equipped with comprehensive marketing expertise and are well positioned for a wide range of exciting career opportunities in marketing roles across different industries.
• Nanyang Business School (NBS)
• Develop 360-degree competency by developing keen consumer insights through a thorough understanding of marketing frameworks, consumer psychology and new technology.
• Be equipped with advanced marketing skill sets to navigate the fast-changing marketing landscape with our cutting-edge modules in AR/VR, AI and Robotics, Consumer Neuroscience & Neuromarketing, and Ethnography.
• Apply classroom learnings to real-world challenges with ease through our practice-oriented teaching approach and interactive classes which foster discussions and debates.
• A good Bachelor's degree from any discipline
• GMAT/GMAT Focus or GRE score (optional)
• TOEFL/IELTS for applicants whose first degree was taught in a language other than English
• Work experience is not required
• GMAT: V27-ZV-91
• GRE: 3123
• TOEFL: 9705
• Round 1: 30 November
• Round 2: 31 January
• Round 3: 31 March
• Strategic Marketing
• Branding
• Marketing Analytics
• Marketing Research
• Finance for Marketing Decisions
• Corporate B2B Marketing
• Integrated Marketing Communications
• Ethnography in Practice
• Consumer Psychology
• Digital Marketing
• A/ VR, AI and Robotics in Marketing
• Consumer Neuroscience & Neuromarketing
• Master of Science in Business Analytics
• Master of Science in Accountancy

The MSc Marketing Science is designed to develop comprehensive marketing expertise with the latest thinking, techniques and tools.


The curriculum delivers the fundamental knowledge of marketing and consumer insights together with the latest knowledge on marketing technology such as AR/VR and AI in marketing, to empower participants to lead marketing campaigns in this digital
era.

For full programme details, please refer to MSc Marketing Science.







Companies are increasingly aware of the value of technologies such as data analytics and artificial intelligence in developing more effective and intelligent marketing. As such, this intensive and academically challenging programme focuses on developing a holistic understanding in the field of marketing through comprehensive and up-to-date knowledge of consumer insight and technology. 

Upon completion, our participants will: 




Develop 360-degree competency by developing keen consumer insights through a thorough understanding of marketing frameworks, consumer psychology and new technology. 


Be equipped with advanced marketing skill sets to navigate the fast-changing marketing landscape with our cutting-edge modules in AR/VR, AI and Robotics, Consumer Neuroscience & Neuromarketing, and Ethnography.  


Apply classroom learnings to real-world challenges with ease through our practice-oriented teaching approach and interactive classes which foster discussions and debates. 









Applicants who wish to apply to the MSc Marketing Science are required to meet the admission requirements below: A good Bachelor's degree from any discipline GMAT/GMAT Focus or GRE score (optional) TOEFL/IELTS for applicants whose first degree was taught in a language other than English Work experience is not required The institutional code for the following tests are: GMAT: V27-ZV-91 GRE: 3123TOEFL: 9705 Application Deadlines: Round 1: 30 NovemberRound 2: 31 JanuaryRound 3: 31 MarchApplications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and early submission is encouraged. Programme Fee (Academic Year 2024):S$63,220.00 (inclusive of 9% GST and enrolment fee)Application Fee:S$100






MSc Marketing Science is a one-year full-time programme and our modules are built on three areas of focus – Marketing, Consumer Insights and Technology. 
An optional internship module is available to participants who wish to gain real-world work experience.  The internship will take place from July to December after the completion of all the modules in Trimester 3.






MMS participants will complete 12 modules over three trimesters in a year.   
Core Modules: 

Strategic Marketing 
Branding 
Marketing Analytics 
Marketing Research 
Finance for Marketing Decisions
Corporate B2B Marketing

Consumer Insight Modules:

Integrated Marketing Communications
Ethnography in Practice
Consumer Psychology

Technology Modules:

Digital Marketing 
A/ VR, AI and Robotics in Marketing
Consumer Neuroscience & Neuromarketing







Our MSc Marketing Science graduates are equipped with comprehensive marketing expertise and are well positioned for a wide range of exciting career opportunities in marketing roles across different industries.

Get ready for an education experience like no other. With a diverse list of programmes to choose from, pick one that best suits your interests. Our broad based curriculum gives you the option of personalising your degree with a host of minors and electives. Challenge yourself and go beyond the boundaries of your discipline to discover new courses that will open unparalleled opportunities in the professional world. Be mentored by world-renowned professors, learn alongside talented peers, discover the advantages of overseas exchange and benefit from our extensive network of academic and industry partnerships to be transformed into a truly global citizen.

Provided by
Programme Type
Full-time, Part-time
Master of Science in Asset and Wealth Management
The Master of Science in Asset and Wealth Management (MAWM) is a postgraduate degree programme issued by the Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Singapore. Jointly developed by the Wealth Management Institute (WMI) and Nanyang Business School (NBS) the programme was launched to cater to the growing demand for highly-trained expertise in the asset and wealth management sectors.
Designed to groom future-ready asset and wealth management professionals, this one year programme is aligned to the latest industry skills frameworks established by the Institute of Banking and Finance Singapore (IBF). Supported by WMI’s deep industry
links and domain expertise in practice-based asset and wealth management education, along with the strength of a top ranking university, the MAWM presents a leading edge curriculum that stays relevant to current and future industry.
For full programme details, please refer to MSc Asset & Wealth Management.
The MAWM is a first of its kind in Singapore specialising in asset management and wealth management. The programme is also cross-disciplinary, tapping NTU’s globally renowned strength in computing technology and mathematical sciences, as well as social science and psychology. The Master of Science in Asset & Wealth Management is taught by outstanding academics and leading practitioners, and curated to ensure you are future-ready for these industries.
The degree is issued by NTU Singapore, a research-intensive university consistently ranked among the top in the world.
The programme takes you from Singapore to UK and USA to attend specially curated lectures by global experts at our partner universities, Imperial College Business School (London) and Chicago Booth School of Business (Chicago). You will also have the opportunity to participate in corporate visits at top international firms in New York, giving you exposure that will deepen your learning and complement topics taught in class.
Unique Work-Study Format
Our unique work-study format is designed to allow you to work while concurrently taking on the challenge of this Master’s Degree. Classes are conducted on alternate weekends, enabling easy participation by working professionals, as well as the flexibility of year-round internship placement for interns. A minimum 3-month internship is structured as part of the Master’s degree to provide you with the necessary practice experience if you are not already in the industry.
You may choose to complete the programme in a 12 month period, with classes to be held in Singapore on alternate weekends, while the overseas modules conducted in UK and USA will run for 2 consecutive weeks. You may also prefer to space out your learning, taking the programme in modules and complete within a period of 2 years for Full-Time students and 3 years for Part-Time students.
You will be taught not only by outstanding academics but also leading industry practitioners who are committed to imparting practical knowledge. WMI has also partnered with top financial institutions to host high impact learning visits that are integrated with the programme to provide a truly immersive learning experience.
The MAWM is designed to attract a diverse and distinct cohort of students from Singapore and from further afield, giving you the opportunity to convene and create lasting networks as you study alongside professionals from banks, asset management firms, regulatory institutions, central banks, and other financial institutions from Asia and around the world.
The admission requirements for the Master of Science in Asset & Wealth Management are:
An admissions interview will be required for shortlisted candidates.
Disclaimer: Travel, accommodation and other incidental expenses are not provided for in the fees. The Wealth Management Institute reserves the rights to alter the fees or make any changes to the programme as appropriate.
The MAWM is a one year programme with a unique work-study format that incorporates two overseas learning modules. Classess are conducted on alternate weekends which enables easy participation by working professionals. Participants start the programme with a set of core modules after which they will then be given the option to select electives.
BUILDING A STRONG FINANCE CORE

Up to S$545**
Tuition Fee
S$45,750***
S$33,750***
Travel, accommodation and other incidental expenses are not provided for in the fees.
*A non-refundable application fee is required upon application.
**A one-time miscellaneous fee will be billed in the first trimester.
***Fees shown are after IBF-STS funding assuming students meet the minimum academic standards outlined by IBF and are physically based in Singapore. The fees are also subject to IBF accreditation approval for all modules. The fees listed are inclusive of 9% GST and are payable in instalments. The Wealth Management Institute and the Nanyang Technological University reserves the rights to alter the fees or make any changes to the programme as appropriate. The fees are also subjected to prevailing funding subsidies and accreditation status of the modules. The information above is correct at the time of publication. The Wealth Management Institute and the Nanyang Technological University reserve the right to amend the fees and/or terms and conditions as appropriate.
• Nanyang Business School (NBS)
• At least 2 years of working experience
• A good Bachelor’s degree in a relevant programme
• Competitive GMAT/GMAT Focus or GRE score
• TOEFL score: > 100 or IELTS score: > 6.5, if English was not the medium of instruction used at the undergraduate level
• Compliance, Ethics and Leadership
• Data-Science and Fintech I
• Data-Science and FinTech II
• ESG for Asset Managers
• Investment Products and Advisory
• Portfolio Management
• Reserve Management
• Wealth Planning
• Quantitative Trading Strategies (Imperial College Business School)
• Alternative Investments (The University of Chicago Booth School of Business)
• Corporate Finance
• Equity and Fixed Income Analysis
• Financial Statement Analysis
• Macroeconomics; Cycles, Crises and Bubbles
• Advanced Wealth Planning, Family Office and Business Succession
• Client Relationship Management
• Cross Banking
• Financial Modelling and Quantitative Methods for Investment
• Investment Systems, Operations and Marketing
• Full-Time students will be required to complete a (minimally) 3-months internship
• Master of Science in Marketing Science
• Master of Science in Business Analytics
• Master of Science in Accountancy

The Master of Science in Asset and Wealth Management (MAWM) is a postgraduate degree programme issued by the Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Singapore. Jointly developed by the Wealth Management Institute (WMI) and Nanyang Business School (NBS) the programme was launched to cater to the growing demand for highly-trained expertise in the asset and wealth management sectors.


Designed to groom future-ready asset and wealth management professionals, this one year programme is aligned to the latest industry skills frameworks established by the Institute of Banking and Finance Singapore (IBF). Supported by WMI’s deep industry
links and domain expertise in practice-based asset and wealth management education, along with the strength of a top ranking university, the MAWM presents a leading edge curriculum that stays relevant to current and future industry.
For full programme details, please refer to MSc Asset & Wealth Management. 






Leading-Edge CurriculumThe MAWM is a first of its kind in Singapore specialising in asset management and wealth management. The programme is also cross-disciplinary, tapping NTU’s globally renowned strength in computing technology and mathematical sciences, as well as social science and psychology. The Master of Science in Asset & Wealth Management is taught by outstanding academics and leading practitioners, and curated to ensure you are future-ready for these industries.The degree is issued by NTU Singapore, a research-intensive university consistently ranked among the top in the world.Classes In Singapore, UK, And USAThe programme takes you from Singapore to UK and USA to attend specially curated lectures by global experts at our partner universities, Imperial College Business School (London) and Chicago Booth School of Business (Chicago). You will also have the opportunity to participate in corporate visits at top international firms in New York, giving you exposure that will deepen your learning and complement topics taught in class.Unique Work-Study FormatOur unique work-study format is designed to allow you to work while concurrently taking on the challenge of this Master’s Degree. Classes are conducted on alternate weekends, enabling easy participation by working professionals, as well as the flexibility of year-round internship placement for interns. A minimum 3-month internship is structured as part of the Master’s degree to provide you with the necessary practice experience if you are not already in the industry.You may choose to complete the programme in a 12 month period, with classes to be held in Singapore on alternate weekends, while the overseas modules conducted in UK and USA will run for 2 consecutive weeks. You may also prefer to space out your learning, taking the programme in modules and complete within a period of 2 years for Full-Time students and 3 years for Part-Time students.Industry As Your FacultyYou will be taught not only by outstanding academics but also leading industry practitioners who are committed to imparting practical knowledge. WMI has also partnered with top financial institutions to host high impact learning visits that are integrated with the programme to provide a truly immersive learning experience.Distinctive CohortThe MAWM is designed to attract a diverse and distinct cohort of students from Singapore and from further afield, giving you the opportunity to convene and create lasting networks as you study alongside professionals from banks, asset management firms, regulatory institutions, central banks, and other financial institutions from Asia and around the world.






The admission requirements for the Master of Science in Asset & Wealth Management are:At least 2 years of working experienceA good Bachelor’s degree in a relevant programmeCompetitive GMAT/GMAT Focus or GRE scoreTOEFL score: > 100 or IELTS score: > 6.5, if English was not the medium of instruction used at the undergraduate levelAn admissions interview will be required for shortlisted candidates.Next IntakeApplication OpensInterview / Selection ProcessApplication ClosesMatriculationOrientationJuly 2026August 20251 January - March 202615 April 2026June 2026June 2026Disclaimer: Travel, accommodation and other incidental expenses are not provided for in the fees. The Wealth Management Institute reserves the rights to alter the fees or make any changes to the programme as appropriate.






The MAWM is a one year programme with a unique work-study format that incorporates two overseas learning modules. Classess are conducted on alternate weekends which enables easy participation by working professionals. Participants start the programme with a set of core modules after which they will then be given the option to select electives. 






NURTURING FUTURE-READY LEADERSCompliance, Ethics and LeadershipData-Science and Fintech IData-Science and FinTech IIESG for Asset ManagersInvestment Products and AdvisoryPortfolio ManagementReserve ManagementWealth PlanningQuantitative Trading Strategies (Imperial College Business School)Alternative Investments (The University of Chicago Booth School of Business)BUILDING A STRONG FINANCE CORECorporate FinanceEquity and Fixed Income AnalysisFinancial Statement AnalysisMacroeconomics; Cycles, Crises and BubblesELECTIVESAdvanced Wealth Planning, Family Office and Business SuccessionClient Relationship ManagementCross BankingFinancial Modelling and Quantitative Methods for InvestmentInvestment Systems, Operations and MarketingINTERNSHIPFull-Time students will be required to complete a (minimally) 3-months internship






PROGRAMME FEE (Academic Year 2026)Programme FeeInternational Students (W/GST)Singaporeans under 40 & Permanent Residents (W/GST After IBF-STS Funding)Singaporeans 40 and above (W/GST After IBF-STS Funding)Application FeeS$100*Miscellaneous FeeUp to S$545**Tuition FeeS$81,750S$45,750***S$33,750***Note :Travel, accommodation and other incidental expenses are not provided for in the fees.*A non-refundable application fee is required upon application.**A one-time miscellaneous fee will be billed in the first trimester.***Fees shown are after IBF-STS funding assuming students meet the minimum academic standards outlined by IBF and are physically based in Singapore. The fees are also subject to IBF accreditation approval for all modules. The fees listed are inclusive of 9% GST and are payable in instalments. The Wealth Management Institute and the Nanyang Technological University reserves the rights to alter the fees or make any changes to the programme as appropriate. The fees are also subjected to prevailing funding subsidies and accreditation status of the modules. The information above is correct at the time of publication. The Wealth Management Institute and the Nanyang Technological University reserve the right to amend the fees and/or terms and conditions as appropriate.

Provided by
Programme Type
MSc Accountancy
Master the language of business and accelerate your career in accounting and finance with Singapore’s first and most established accounting school, and gain direct access to the Professional Programme of the Singapore Chartered Accountant qualification.
For full programme details, please refer to MSc Accountancy.
SINGAPORE’S ACCOUNTING POWERHOUSE
A CURRICULUM FOCUSED ON FUTURE-READINESS
The programme’s rigorous and innovative industry-relevant curriculum aims to develop you holistically so that you enjoy high employability upon graduation. Modules such as Forensic Accounting and Digital Forensics, and Data Analytics and Machine Learning for Accounting will equip you with the skill sets to succeed in the fast-evolving accounting landscape. Besides learning from our world-class faculty, you will also have access to ample networking opportunities with industry partners.
STRONG INDUSTRY CONNECTIONS
Applicants who wish to apply to the MSc Accountancy are required to meet the minimum admission requirements below:
The institutional code for the following tests are:
Application deadline:
Programme Fee (August 2024 Intake):
S$61,040.00 (inclusive of 9% GST and enrolment fee)
Application Fee:
The MSc Accountancy is a one-year full-time programme.
The programme covers 15 courses. Up to 2 waivers are allowed, based on previous extensive coverage in your undergraduate programme, subject to approval from the School. Waivers will be substituted with Master's level electives.
*All our courses are conducted in English, on NTU's vibrant campuses in Singapore.
The MSc Accountancy curriculum consists of 15 courses. AI and Automation is fast changing the work of accounting professionals and we have updated our curriculum to include Data Analytics & Machine Learning for Accounting and Forensic Accounting and Digital Forensics to ensure that our participants are equipped for the fast evolving accounting landscape.
Graduates from the General Track can advance directly to the Professional Programme of the Singapore CA Qualification. The School’s strong connections with the international accounting bodies such as ICAEW, CPA Australia, ACCA, CIMA, to name a few, allows our graduates to fast track their professional accounting qualification journey.
The MSc Accountancy programme is also accredited by the Singapore Accountancy Commission (SAC) and Institute of Singapore Chartered Accountants (ISCA).
• Nanyang Business School (NBS)
• A good Bachelor's degree from any discipline
• A good GMAT/GMAT Focus or GRE score is recommended
• TOEFL/IELTS for applicants whose first degree was taught in a language other than English
• Work experience is a plus but not required
• GMAT: V24-ZV-83
• GRE: 3123
• TOEFL: 9705
• Round 1: 30 November
• Round 2: 31 January
• Round 3: 31 March
• Business Analysis and Equity Valuation
• Accounting for Decision Making and Control
• Accounting Information Systems
• Accounting Recognition and Measurement
• Assurance and Auditing
• Company Law
• Data Analytics & Machine Learning for Accounting
• Financial Accounting
• Financial Management
• Forensic Accounting and Digital Forensics
• Management of Legal Obligations in Business
• Risk Management and Advanced Auditing
• Risk Reporting and Analysis
• Strategic Management
• Tax Management
• Master of Science in Business Analytics
• Master of Science in Marketing Science
• Master of Science in Asset & Wealth Management

Full-time




MSc Accountancy

Apply now










Master the language of business and accelerate your career in accounting and finance with Singapore’s first and most established accounting school, and gain direct access to the Professional Programme of the Singapore Chartered Accountant qualification.



Accelerate your career in accounting and finance with Singapore's first and most established accounting school and embark on the MSc Accountancy (MACC) programme, a comprehensive 12-month full-time programme offering two specialised tracks: General and Data Analytics. The MACC curriculum is meticulously crafted to equip participants with the essential skills for navigating the dynamic accounting landscape of the future. Engage with cutting-edge modules such as Forensic Accounting and Digital Forensics, as well as Data Analytics and Machine Learning for Accounting. Our programme ensures industry readiness by fostering strong connections with leading firms where selected modules are co-taught by experts from the renowned Big Four accounting companies.The MACC programme is accredited by the Singapore Accountancy Commission (SAC) and graduates enrolled in the general track are able to fast track their professional accounting qualification journey by advancing directly to the Professional Programme of the Singapore Chartered Accountant Qualification. Additionally, regardless of which track participants are enrolled in, they will enjoy significant exemptions with international accounting bodies such as ICAEW, CPA Australia, ACCA, CI MA, to name a few. For full programme details, please refer to MSc Accountancy.






SINGAPORE’S ACCOUNTING POWERHOUSE
NBS houses Singapore’s first and most established accountancy school in Asia. We have more than 50 years of track record in training executives in accounting and finance-related fields. We are among the top 5 in experimental audit research with Professor Tan Hun Tong being a world leader in this field. Many of our faculty members serve on the council and committees of ISCA, and together with our alumni who are well-recognised industry leaders, we are actively shaping the accounting profession.

 


A CURRICULUM FOCUSED ON FUTURE-READINESS


The programme’s rigorous and innovative industry-relevant curriculum aims to develop you holistically so that you enjoy high employability upon graduation. Modules such as Forensic Accounting and Digital Forensics, and Data Analytics and Machine Learning for Accounting will equip you with the skill sets to succeed in the fast-evolving accounting landscape. Besides learning from our world-class faculty, you will also have access to ample networking opportunities with industry partners.
 
STRONG INDUSTRY CONNECTIONS

Selected modules are conceptualised and co-taught with domain experts from Big Four accounting firms, ensuring high industry relevance and the robust application of advanced accounting knowledge in real-world business settings.

Our curriculum is designed in close consultation with industry partners to reflect business demands and needs. You will have access to actual data and company internship opportunities that allow you to apply what you learn in the classroom to a real-world setting. Such valuable industry exposure will boost your understanding of the nature of the work in business analytics and help put you in a strong position for a future career in this field.

Electives :

AI with Advanced Predictive Techniques in Finance
Design Thinking & Technology Management
Data Analytics for Credit and Related Risk
Insurance Analytics
Information Systems & ERP (SAP)
Machine Learning Methodology
Blockchain for Business
Introduction to Cyber Security
Operations Analytics  

All Core Modules and Electives might be subject to changes.
Graduates from the programme are typically considered in business analyst roles. Through the programme’s strong industry partnerships, participants can also take advantage of internship opportunities with industry leaders such as DBS, KPMG and GE Digital. These open doors to strong employment prospects and provide relevant practical experience to prepare graduates to take on business analytics roles.

LEARNING NEVER STOPS
Elevate Your Career with NTU’s World-Class Lifelong Learning Programmes
Consistently ranked among the top global universities, NTU Singapore offers unparalleled education through our cutting-edge Lifelong Learning programmes. With over 600 graduate programmes and professional development courses, including
    specialisations in AI, Data Analytics, Sustainability, and Healthcare, you can explore diverse fields and advance your career. Our flexible learning pathways ensure that you
    find the perfect fit for your career goals and personal aspirations.
Courses are designed and delivered by industry leaders and experts, in collaboration with top global partners such as AWS, Emeritus, and Mastercard. Benefit from world-class education and stay ahead in your career with programmes tailored
    to keep you industry-relevant and future-ready.
Discover how NTU’s cutting-edge Lifelong Learning programmes can keep you agile and relevant as you pursue professional growth.
The INSTEP initiative is a collaboration between NTU and the Indonesia Endowment Fund for Education Agency (LPDP) along with the Indonesian Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology (MoECRT), offering full financial support for Indonesian candidates to pursue a full-time Master's degree at NTU. This initiative aims to foster academic excellence and strengthen educational ties between Singapore and Indonesia, empowering future leaders with world-class postgraduate education.Date: 16 July 2025, WedTime: 1.00pm - 2.00pm (WIB); 2.00pm - 3.00pm (SGT)Register now to find out more.
We are excited to announce the launch of our Early Admissions Scheme for high-achieving students, available by invitation only.
Early Admissions Window: 1st July – 31st August 2025
If shortlisted, we will touch base with you to complete your early admissions journey.
This exclusive opportunity is designed to recognise and fast-track high achievers like you. Successful applicants will be among the first to secure a place in our AY2026 August intake.
For applicants who are not shortlisted, you will be automatically considered in our Regular Admissions Round.
Discover NTU’s wide range of programmes designed to help you succeed and stay ahead in the global landscape.
Explore NTU's professional development courses to stay industry-relevant and enhance your skills. Benefit from SkillsFuture Singapore funding and enrol in NTU's FlexiMasters for a flexible learning pathway to an NTU Master's Degree. Courses are available both in-person and online to fit your busy professional schedule.
Earn an internationally recognised NTU Master’s Degree or Doctor of Philosophy through immersive coursework with specialised curricula tailored to your goals. Our programmes provide a rigorous academic experience and practical insights, designed and delivered by NTU’s world-class faculty of experts.
Push the boundaries of knowledge and earn an NTU Master’s Degree or Doctor of Philosophy through research. Dive deep into your chosen field and develop expertise under the mentorship of NTU’s esteemed faculty. Engage in pioneering projects that contribute to significant academic excellence and innovation.

Coursework programmes admit both full time and part time students, unless stated otherwise.

Graduate Freshmen Guide for newly offered candidates
NTU alumni benefit from professional development opportunities and learning incentives when enrolling in programmes at their alma mater.
Singaporeans and Permanent Residents can receive up to 90% SkillsFuture course fee funding, along with personalised career consultation services.
Understand the financial aspects of pursuing graduate studies at NTU, including tuition fees, scholarships, grants, and other financial aids available.
Dr Koh Hau Tek completed the Nanyang EMBA programme. After many years as a medical doctor, he sought a greater purpose and fresh insights to advance professionally. Now, he integrates his medical and business experience to deliver healthcare benefits on a larger scale.
Serena completed the FlexiMasters in Business and Financial Analytics upon graduating. Her transition from biomedical sciences to bio-analytics and bioinformatics marked a significant career shift. Her role has since expanded to include analytics, showcasing her successful adaptation.
Dr Kwa Kai Xiang completed his PhD in Public Policy and Global Affairs, where he gained significant research and teaching experience. He collaborated on an award-winning project on AI governance, published in prestigious journals, and presented at international conferences.
Yu Te completed the MSc Technopreneurship and Innovation Programme and valued the mentorship from professors with entrepreneurial and industry experience. He appreciated the extensive resources, which provided him with a deeper understanding of the field.
Matilda completed the FlexiMasters in Early Childhood Education. The flexible learning pathway of FlexiMasters and supportive environment encouraged her to pursue her Master’s degree. The insights gained are directly applicable to her work in the industry.
Damian completed the Certificate in AI Ethics and Governance and has transitioned to a new role as Global CIO. The programme has been instrumental in shaping his approach to adopting AI only where it effectively addresses real business challenges.

Graduate Programmes (by Coursework) INSTEP Info session
The INSTEP initiative is a collaboration between NTU and the Indonesia Endowment Fund for Education Agency (LPDP) along with the Indonesian Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology (MoECRT), offering full financial support for Indonesian candidates to pursue a full-time Master's degree at NTU. This initiative aims to foster academic excellence and strengthen educational ties between Singapore and Indonesia, empowering future leaders with world-class postgraduate education.Date: 16 July 2025, WedTime: 1.00pm - 2.00pm (WIB); 2.00pm - 3.00pm (SGT)Register now to find out more.

Beware of fake email, SMS and WhatsApp messages: check before clicking. Read more
In the QS World University Rankings by Subject 2025, NTU shines in emerging fields that are shaping the future, while still staying strong in its core areas.
Get the full list of all our prospectus at a glance
Discover the wide range of programmes offered across all our schools and colleges for a broad-based education
Learn about our tuition fees, grants and other help available from the University
The programme equips you to address complex challenges and foster innovation in manufacturing sectors like pharmaceuticals, petrochemicals, energy, and materials...
The programme provides students with a solid technical foundation in AI and extensive practical exposure to ethical AI system design...
This is a new integrated Major,  four-year honours degree programme, where students learn to integrate multiple disciplinary approaches...
This four-year degree programme focuses on Chinese medicine and basic Western medicine knowledge, with the intention of producing...
With a curriculum spanning mechanical, electrical, mechatronics, and AI-focused courses, you will be ready for both research and real-world robotics applications.
An interdisciplinary degree that blends deep domain knowledge in finance and strong technological and analytical skillsets through...
Integrating sustainability, analytics, and a unique work-study component. Immerse in a 30-week internship with ACRA-recognized ATOs...
Learn how you can maintain the health of our world for the benefit of current and future generations, by understanding how our env…
Discover a range of new programmes that enable you to harness the potential of AI to solve real-world challenges.
Get cutting-edge knowledge in field of AI through a specially designed scholars programme that will enable you to take on the challenges of a world shaped by AI.
Get ready to be part of one of the fastest-growing tech sectors with a degree that exposes you to AI system design, development, and deployment in real-world settings.
Find innovative solutions to society’s pressing challenges across areas ranging from healthcare, business and finance, environmental sustainability to science and technology.
Designed for diverse majors, the Minor in AI gives you a foundational understanding of emerging technologies and their applications across finance, engineering, humanities, and more.
NTU offers a variety of scholarships to new and current students pursuing their full-time undergraduate studies based on academic merit & good co-curricular records.
Discover friends with activities and organizations, leadership, athletics and fitness, health and wellness, and support and guidance on campus.
Our halls offers a supportive environment in which to live, learn, and forge friendships. Learn more and apply for on-campus housing.
Learning truly takes on an international dimension with numerous opportunities to go abroad for exchange programmes, internships, projects and more.
Here’s a selection of some of the most iconic buildings, recreational spaces and fun spots for you to visit on the NTU Smart Campus. Enjoy a virtual tour or drop by to see what makes NTU one of the top most beautiful campuses in the world.
When it comes to your future, there’s no one-size-fits-all approach. With an NTU degree, you’ll be able to adapt fluidly to a rapidly changing future.
Explore more stories that showcase how an NTU degree is built with agility and flexibility at its core.
Taking part in NTU leadership programmes that include overseas experiences is one way that students gain soft skills like flexibility and resilience, which are sought after by employers.
A freshman at NTU’s Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, Aidan Grewal is confident that the school’s unique focus on patient-centred care, will help shape him into a skilled and compassionate doctor.
As a Turing AI Programme scholar, Su Ying gains exclusive access to AI masterclasses, as well as global academic and industry immersion .
Extensive travel opportunities and early exposure to research were key to CNYSP student Cherrie Chong picking NTU
NTU-University Scholars Programme is shaping Wei Chong into an all-rounder with a broad skill set through interdisciplinary learning and exploration beyond his major.
As a Renaissance Engineering Programme student, Sheng Rui graduates with a Bachelor of Engineering Science and a Master of Science in Technology Management in just four and a half years.

From global research stints to international study trips, NTU’s CN Yang Programme helps Izzuddin explore the world and realise his dream of working overseas.

askST: What can I do as a university student to prepare for a fulfilling career?
Taking part in NTU leadership programmes that include overseas experiences is one way that students gain soft skills like flexibility and resilience, which are sought after by employers.









A prescription for success
A freshman at NTU’s Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, Aidan Grewal is confident that the school’s unique focus on patient-centred care, will help shape him into a skilled and compassionate doctor.
